resources.string: Change the language of the app
Sets the theme of this app
Start the app when the phone is turned on
Start the app after it has been updated
Exclude apps from the app here, for example if they cannot connect to the Internet anymore - selected apps won\'t use dns-over-https anymore
Sets whether to show the notification on the lockscreen
Use a simple text in the notification
Hide the icon from the navigation bar on the top
Allow the app to be stopped from the notification
Allow the app to be paused from the notification
Show a notification when the app has no or a bad connection
Show a notification when Nebulo loses permission to the VPN
Ask for a PIN when opening or stopping the app
Allow your fingerprint to be used instead of the PIN
Change the PIN. Only numeric values are allowed.\nCurrent PIN: %1s
Enables the apps DNS cache. The cache memorizes old requests to answer future questions faster.\n\nThe system already has a cache, enable this if you want to customize behavior
Keep the DNS cache across multiple launches
Click here to clear the DNS cache, for example when websites start misbehaving because they are cached
Sets the maximum of entries the cache can hold at any time
Keep requests in the cache for as long as the DNS server communicates using the TTL

The minimum amount of time entries should be cached, no matter whether the default caching time for it would be shorter. Long caching times could cause the cached data to be out of sync with the actual data.\nCurrent: %1d Seconds

Changes how long all requests are cached, no matter whether the default caching time for it would be longer. Long caching times could cause the cached data to be out of sync with the actual data.\nCurrent: %1d Seconds
Changes the amount of time NXDOMAIN requests are cached. This enhances performance for non-existing domains (e.g if they are blocked)\nCurrent: %1d Seconds
Enables logging of debug information (contains statistic data). These logs aren\'t send automatically
Adds more logging, which could help with more persistent problems
Click here to send the logs to the developer
Deletes all logs stored on your device
Configure what data should be transmitted to the developer when the app crashes. Crash data never contains personal data and helps fixing problems faster
Use IPv6, if the device has an IPv6 address assigned
Use IPv4, if the device has an IPv4 address assigned
Force the app to accept IPv6 requests, even when the device doesn\'t use IPv6
Force the app to accept IPv4 requests, even when the device doesn\'t use IPv4
Allow IPv4 traffic to be used, even if IPv4 is disabled.\nIf disabled no IPv4 connections are allowed while the app is running
Allow IPv6 traffic to be used, even if IPv4 is disabled.\nIf disabled no IPv6 connections are allowed while the app is running
Silently restart the app when the network changes. Enable this when facing problems when switching between networks.\n No effect when the app isn\'t active
Don\'t allow other VPNs to start if the app isn\'t explicitly stopped
Intercept traffic of known DNS servers and transmit it using Nebulo
Interpret refused queries as disallowed hosts
Some DNS servers might refuse to answer a query if the host isn\'t allowed or is blocked. This setting blocks the host instead of refusing the query, otherwise the system might get confused
Send search domains (e.g. MyPC.local or MyPc.fritz.box) to the Dns server of your network instead of the DoH server.\nThis is highly recommended. Those queries don\'t leave your network
Don\'t use DoH if a captive portal is detected. It will automatically be resumed shortly after logging in.\nDisabling it might prevent you from opening the captive portal site to log in
Log all queries and their responses
Click here to delete all logged queries
